intro: Cardiospermum corindum f. leptocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruit heartseed. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive seed pods. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in moist, open habitats.
